00060 /*===========================================================================
00061  *      Description :   Multi-level symbol table.
00062  *==========================================================================*/
00063 #ifndef C_SYMBOL2_H
00064 #define C_SYMBOL2_H
00065 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00066 #include <config.h>
00067 #include <library/c_symbol.h>
00068 
00069 /*
00070  *      We maintain an unique scope_id number with each
00071  *      lexical scope we encounter. The same scope_id
00072  *      information is written into every symbol, so we
00073  *      know exactly which lexical scope every symbol
00074  *      belongs to. This will help us flatten out the
00075  *      symbol table in the semantic analyzer portion.
00076  *      C2_CurrentScope designates the ID number of the current
00077  *      lexical scope. C2_PeakScope designates the highest ID
00078  *      we have achieved. When a new scope is desired, we
00079  *      assign it with (C2_PeakScope+1).
00080  *
00081  *      Use C_MATCH_BY_AND_TYPE.
00082  *
00083  *      EXPORT functions :
00084  *
00085  *      C2_init_scope(n_scope, s_global, s_local);
00086  *              This function must be called before any of the other
00087  *              functions are called. It initialize the entire symbol
00088  *              table the first time it is called.
00089  *              The current scope is set to default at level 0.
00090  *              n_scope is the number of scopes that we need.
00091  *              s_global is the maximum size of the global symbol
00092  *              table. s_local is the size of all local symbol tables.
00093  *      C2_kill_scope_above(N)
00094  *      int N;
00095  *              Kill all definition at and above level N.
00096  *              One must be very sure that the definition
00097  *              will not be accessed again. The major use of this
00098  *              function is that the compiler front-end can
00099  *              recycle all space after processing each function.
00100  *              This is safe if information does not live across
00101  *              function boundary (except level 0). Therefore,
00102  *              C2_kill_scope_above(1) is called after processing a
00103  *              function. C2_kill_scope_above(0) is called after processing 
00104  *              the entire file, since in C each file can be treated
00105  *              as an independent entity.
00106  *              If (N<=nest), the current scope is set to point to max(N-1,0).
00107  *              Otherwise, the current scope is maintained.
00108  *      C2_reset_attribute(n);
00109  *              int n;
00110  *              Clear all extension fields of all symbols above level N.
00111  *      C2_scope_in();
00112  *              Create a new scope in nest+1 level.
00113  *              Set the newly created scope to be the current scope.
00114  *      C2_scope_out();
00115  *              Return to the previous level (nest-1).
00116  *              Do not deallocate the scopes
00117  *
00118  *      int C2_find_symbol(name, type, &value, &ptr)
00119  *              Search from the current scope to lower level scopes
00120  *              for the first symbol with the specified name.
00121  *              Return nil_sym if the symbol is never defined
00122  *              in reachable scopes. Notice that the symbol may
00123  *              be defined in scopes unreachable from the current
00124  *              scope. In such cases, we treat as search failure.
00125  *              Match symbols of type specified in type only.
00126  *              Return the scope id where the symbol was found.
00127  *              If no such symbol, return -1.
00128  *
00129  *      int C2_update_symbol(name, type, value, ptr)
00130  *              Add a symbol to the current level.
00131  *              If the symbol has been defined in the current level,
00132  *              simply add the type information into the symbol.
00133  *              Return the scope id where the symbol was added.
00134  *               
00135  *      int C2_find_local_symbol(name, type, &value, &ptr);
00136  *              Search only the current scope. Returns nil_sym if not found.
00137  *              Match symbols of type specified in type only.
00138  *              Return the scope id where the symbol was found.
00139  *              If no such symbol, return -1.
00140  *
00141  *      int C2_update_local_symbol(name, type, value, ptr)
00142  *              Search only the current scope.
00143  *              Add a symbol to the current level if not yet defined.
00144  *              If the symbol has been defined in the current level,
00145  *              simply add the type information into the symbol.
00146  *              Return the scope id where the symbol was added.
00147  *               
00148  *      int C2_find_global_symbol(name, type, &value, &ptr);
00149  *              Search only the function level.
00150  *              Returns nil_sym if nothing found.
00151  *              Match symbols of type specified in type only.
00152  *              Return the scope id where the symbol was found.
00153  *              If no such symbol, return -1.
00154  *
00155  *      int C2_update_global_symbol(name, type, value, ptr)
00156  *              Search only the function level scope.
00157  *              Add a symbol to the function level if not yet defined.
00158  *              If the symbol has been defined,
00159  *              simply add the type information into the symbol.
00160  *              Return the scope id where the symbol was added.
00161  */
00162 
00163 #define C2_MAX_SCOPE            20
00164 
00165 #ifdef __cplusplus
00166 extern "C"
00167 {
00168 #endif
00169 
00170   extern int C2_init_scope (int num_scope, int s_global, int s_local);
00171   extern void C2_kill_scope_above (int n);
00172   extern void C2_reset_attribute (int n);
00173   extern int C2_scope_in (void);
00174   extern int C2_scope_out (void);
00175   extern int C2_find_symbol (char *name, int type, Integer * value,
00176                              Pointer * ptr);
00177   extern int C2_update_symbol (char *name, int type, Integer value,
00178                                Pointer ptr);
00179   extern int C2_find_local_symbol (char *name, int type, Integer * value,
00180                                    Pointer * ptr);
00181   extern int C2_update_local_symbol (char *name, int type, Integer value,
00182                                      Pointer ptr);
00183   extern int C2_find_global_symbol (char *name, int type, Integer * value,
00184                                     Pointer * ptr);
00185   extern int C2_update_global_symbol (char *name, int type, Integer value,
00186                                       Pointer ptr);
00187   extern int C2_forall (C_Function fn);
00188   extern int C2_forall_global (C_Function fn);
00189 
00190 #ifdef __cplusplus
00191 }
00192 #endif
00193 
00194 #endif
